question: In 1716 the first lighthouse was built in America at Little Brewster Island, Boston, Massachusetts
Who was the first African-American female Commanding Officer of a Coast Guard Cutter?
In 1968, Mary Ashley was the first woman to retire from the regular Coast Guard with full benefits.
The only Coast Guardsman to receive the Medal of Honor is ________.
In 1987, who was the first Coast Guardsmen to become a NASA astronaut?
USRC Grant was the first cutter to use wireless telegraph in 1903.
Name one of the first Maritime Enforcement Specialists that was inducted into the new ME rating in December 2008.
The first woman promoted to CWO (F&S) was ________ in 1987.
The first Cuban-American to command a Coast Guard Cutter was LT. Jorge Martinez on the CGC Maui (WPB-1304) in 2003.
The first active duty African-American woman to be promoted to warrant officer was ________ in 1995.
Thought to be the first ship constructed by the Service.
In April 2008 OSC Patrick Hagan became the first Coast Guardsman to receive the National Operations Security (OPSEC) Award.
________ became the first woman ISS Warrant Officer on 01 June 2010.
________ became the first female school chief for TRACEN Yorktown on 01 June 2008.
This date is recognized as the official birthday of the Coast Guard.
The first active duty woman to be advanced to YNCM was ________.
________ served as the first Commandant of the USCG.
On 01 April 1916, the first Coast Guardsmen, ________ and ________, reported for flight training at the naval air Station in Pensacola, Florida.
answers: Robert S. Provost, Scott J. McKinley

question: ________ was the first female Commanding Officer of the Coast Guard Institute in August 2004.
Captain Jeffrey Lee was the first Korean-American to graduate from Coast Guard OCS in 1983.
With the promotion to rear admiral, ________, USCGR became the first flag officer ever appointed in the U.S. Coast Guard Reserve.
The first woman Coast Guard diver was ________ in 1984.
This cutter was responsible for the first anti-piracy action when it ran a pirate vessel ashore in Chesapeake Bay in 1793.
In 1988 ________ became the first African-American female engineer that advanced to E-7.
Who was the first Chinese-American Coast Guardsman to command a Medium Endurance Cutter when they took command of USCGC Venturous from 1995-1997?

Coast Guard Auxiliarist ________, a public affairs staff officer with Flotilla 74, 8th CG District, became the first sightless Coast Guard employee to serve on board a cutter. He sailed aboard the Dallas on 22 May 2002.
On 16 May 2003, LT Greg Duncan became the first African-American Coast Guardsman to successfully complete the scuba diver course at the Navy Dive and Salvage Center in Panama, Fl.
On 27 September 1944, ________, became the first African-American to be promoted to the rank of lieutenant in the Coast Guard.
The first woman promoted to CWO (ELC) was ________ in 1989.
The Coast Guard's first permanent air station was established at Cape May, New Jersey.
In 2010, ________ served as the Federal On-Scene Coordinator for the Deepwater Horizon Spill.
________ became the first OIC of a LEDET when he took command of Group Hatteras LEDET in September, 1988.
The first woman promoted to CWO (COMMS) was Robin Patton in 1989.
24 April 2004, ________ became the first Coast Guard combat fatality since the Vietnam War.
On 01 November 2000, ________, became the first African-American woman to advance to Master Chief.
Mary Hughes Holmes was the first African-American female reservist to ________.
The first Pacific Islander from Guam promoted to graduate from the USCG Academy and from any military service academy was ________ in 1968.
In 1881 Lime Rock Lighthouse Keeper Ida Lewis becomes the first woman to be awarded a Gold Lifesaving Medal.
In 1998, ________ became the first African-American Master Chief Petty Officer of the Coast Guard.
Who was the first active-duty woman to be advanced to chief petty officer ________.
The first female company commander at Cape May was: ________, 1978.
The first Coast Guard cutter strictly dedicated to oceanographic study.
________ in 1973 became the first SPAR to be sworn into the regular Coast Guard.
On 24 June 2005, LTJG ________, earned her wings and became the first African-American female aviator.
________ became the first Hispanic-American to make rank of chief petty officer when the Coast Guard advanced him to Chief Machinist's Mate on 16 February 1944.
The last woman keeper of a lighthouse in the United States was ________.
January 1942, USCGC ________ was struck by a torpedo while on convoy duty and sank off the coast of Iceland. 26 members of her crew perished in the attack.
What year did the first five African-American females enter into the SPARs program?
________ was the first commissioned SPAR.
19 April 1995 the USCGC ________ rescues 578 migrants from an overloaded 75-foot coastal freighter, the largest number of migrants rescued from a single vessel in Coast Guard history.
The first African-American admiral was Bobby C. Wilks, 1998.
The first Coast Guardsman to "earn jump wings at Fort Benning, Georgia Airborne School" was ________.
Who was the first woman to be advanced to FSCM in 1999?
12 April 1979 ________ assumed command of the ________, becoming the first woman to command a U. S. warship.
answers: LTJG Beverly Kelley, USCGC Cape Newagen

question: On 13 August 1864 Revenue Captain ________ became the first Revenue officer to be killed in action against the enemy.
On 11 November 2006, the first Legend class National Security Cutter USCGC ________ was christened.
________ became the first woman to make Coast Guard Person of the Year for an entire District (D-5 in 1983 and D-3 in 1985).
The first Asian-American female warrant officer was ________.
Admiral Thad W. Allen assumed the duties as the 25th Commandant of the United States Coast Guard on May 25, 2006.
Joseph C. Jenkins is the first officially recognized commissioned African-American officer in the Coast Guard.
